review: I really like my Amazon Fire TV!!! I did have a lower end Web player but, the differences are remarkable. Once you get the hang of the great graphics and colorful menues your on your way to having fun. Great picture, plenty of apps. I've had mine for well over a month and I'm still finding new features to have friends fun with.
author: C. Cauble

review: I have the Apple TV, Roku 2, Fire stick AND the chromecast. The Fire TV is the fastest of them all, with the Roku coming in a close second. The Apple TV, Fire stick and chromecast lag at times too, but not with this one. Everything works great and the remote is very responsive. I highly recommend this.

review: Fire TV has completely changed the way my family watches TV. The best part is that there is enough content available between our Prime subscription and the available apps (some are unofficial and require side-loading), we were able to cancel our DirecTV subscription, which is a HUGE relief all on it's own. I can't imagine going back at this point.
author: Chris Wessel

review: I was very impressed with some of the comments, after reading several I decided that I will purchase the Amazon Fire to experience the hype. Sadly, after having viewing a few shows, the device kept freezing up on most of the channels. After several attempts to prevent freezing I reboots, reset and I was getting an error message. I decided to call Amazon techinical support and what a bigger mess, apparently the first, second nor third rep knew what to do. After several phone calls I finally reached someone who knew what they were talking about.  I had to clear out the cashe two times, reboot it worked for a while, now I'm back to frozen programs. So, I decided to give APPLE TV, a try and I love it easy to maneuver and NO FREEZING! I wish I could give it more stars but unfortunately, I can't. The one thing that I did like was the voice command.
